commit_message:
bundles: remove amqp relation between rabbitmq-server and glance-simplestrams-sync

charm glance-simplestrams-sync has dropped amqp relation:

https://github.com/openstack/charm-glance-simplestreams-sync/commit/9698b5ca2a093a9c8e9e34918357fc0d7b75919d

remove this relation from bundles to get CI tests pass.

Change-Id: I726fd62377b13cf9cd3a6dfd6de197981dd73c94
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <joe.guo@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add support for HAProxy L7 checks

This change add several configuration options to enable HTTP checks
to the HAProxy configuration, instead of the default TCP connection
checks (which continue to be the default).

Change-Id: I8b16ddab3961b4637798f5328a306b70983559fd
Closes-Bug: #1880610

to the new Yoga versions, dropping python3.5
from the unit tests.

[{'created': '2021-10-21 14:29:01.000000000', 'message': "Add force flag to openstack-upgrade action

This flag will allow upgrading to new package versions when they are not
a new release of OpenStack. This can be useful for testing, such as upgrades
to proposed pockets or PPAs, and can also be used to dist-upgrade a unit's
packages to any stable updates that are available.

Change-Id: I3f74b77eb930674a61874c68f5cb66fb1ae7caac
"}, {'created': '2021-10-21 14:30:17.000000000', 'message': "Add force flag to openstack-upgrade action

not a new release of OpenStack. This can be useful for testing, such
as upgrades to proposed pockets or PPAs, and can also be used to
dist-upgrade a unit's packages to any stable updates that are
available.

Change-Id: I3f74b77eb930674a61874c68f5cb66fb1ae7caac
"}, {'created': '2021-10-21 14:31:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add force flag to openstack-upgrade action

This flag will allow upgrading to new package versions regardless of
whether there is a new release of OpenStack available. This can be
useful to dist-upgrade to a proposed pocket or PPA for testing, or
to for upgrade all packages to new stable versions.

Change-Id: I3f74b77eb930674a61874c68f5cb66fb1ae7caac
'}]
commit_message:
Add force flag to openstack-upgrade action

This flag will allow upgrading to new package versions regardless of
whether there is a new release of OpenStack available. This can be
useful to dist-upgrade to a proposed pocket or PPA for testing, or
to for upgrade all packages to new stable versions.

Change-Id: I3f74b77eb930674a61874c68f5cb66fb1ae7caac

commit_message:
Updating the process_list_path config variable

Previously, the process_list_path was pointing to the
wrong and non-existent directory on the filesystem,
causing process-monitor to behave in a wrong way. This
patch is to point the process-monitor to a right config.

Closes-Bug: #1941623
Change-Id: I8126fc9cf946088bcdb33cf2716f1bedd2671646

'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 16:04:02.000000000', 'message': 'Be smarter about RabbitMQ cluster unit startup

After the shutdown of a RabbitMQ cluster, the individual units have to
be booted in reverse order or MNesia will block. This can lead to hook
failures which are hard to recover from.

- Add `start` hook to test the correct startup order
- Inform user in case a unit is blocked on another unit

Change-Id: I6520dc0f2e0fea55b292d0db2831547c584ee851
Co-Authored-By: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 16:11:11.000000000', 'message': 'Be smarter about RabbitMQ cluster unit startup

- Inform user in case a unit is blocked on another unit

Change-Id: I6520dc0f2e0fea55b292d0db2831547c584ee851
Co-Authored-By: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-02 16:15:34.000000000', 'message': 'Be smarter about RabbitMQ cluster unit startup

After the shutdown of a RabbitMQ cluster, the individual units have to
be booted in reverse order or MNesia will block. This can lead to hook
failures which are hard to recover from.

- Add `start` hook to test the correct startup order
- Inform user in case a unit is blocked on another unit

Change-Id: I6520dc0f2e0fea55b292d0db2831547c584ee851
Co-Authored-By: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-03 16:29:19.000000000', 'message': "Be smarter about RabbitMQ cluster unit startup

After the shutdown of a RabbitMQ cluster, the individual units have to
be booted in reverse order or MNesia will block [1]. This can lead to
hook failures which are hard to recover from.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a RabbitMQ HA deployment with units rabbitmq-server/{0,1,2}
2. Shutdown rabbitmq-server units in order [0, 1, 2]
3. Boot rabbitmq-server/0

The `update-status` hook on rabbitmq-server/0 will fail because the
rabbitmq-server.service can not start without the other two units.

Steps to mitigate:

The Mnesia database maintains the online status of the other brokers
in the RabbitMQ cluster [1]. We can query that status on charm `start`
and inform the operator that other units need to be booted also.

This change introduces an Erlang script which queries the Mnesia
database for the online status of the cluster units. The change also
introduces a `start` hook which uses the information gathered from the
Erlang script to determine whether the other rabbitmq-server units
that are necessary for startup are available. If they aren't the
status is updated appropriately to indicate to the operator which
other units need to be started up.

[1] https://erlang.org/doc/apps/mnesia/Mnesia_chap7.html#loading-tables-at-startup

Change-Id: I6520dc0f2e0fea55b292d0db2831547c584ee851

commit_message:
Be smarter about RabbitMQ cluster unit startup

After the shutdown of a RabbitMQ cluster, the individual units have to
be booted in reverse order or MNesia will block [1]. This can lead to
hook failures which are hard to recover from.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a RabbitMQ HA deployment with units rabbitmq-server/{0,1,2}
2. Shutdown rabbitmq-server units in order [0, 1, 2]
3. Boot rabbitmq-server/0

The `update-status` hook on rabbitmq-server/0 will fail because the
rabbitmq-server.service can not start without the other two units.

Steps to mitigate:

The Mnesia database maintains the online status of the other brokers
in the RabbitMQ cluster [1]. We can query that status on charm `start`
and inform the operator that other units need to be booted also.

This change introduces an Erlang script which queries the Mnesia
database for the online status of the cluster units. The change also
introduces a `start` hook which uses the information gathered from the
Erlang script to determine whether the other rabbitmq-server units
that are necessary for startup are available. If they aren't the
status is updated appropriately to indicate to the operator which
other units need to be started up.

[1] https://erlang.org/doc/apps/mnesia/Mnesia_chap7.html#loading-tables-at-startup

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/323

Change-Id: I6520dc0f2e0fea55b292d0db2831547c584ee851
Closes-Bug: #1828988
Co-Authored-By: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-03 16:56:56.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude erasure coded pools from eligible pools

Filter erasure coded pools from the list of eligible pools since
Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not
provide a simple way when querying the pools to see if they are
acting as a metadata pool for an erasure coded RBD pool, the
metadata pools are automatically excluded by naming convention.

For those scenarios where the metadata pool does not follow the
naming convention (<pool>-metadata), a new config option is added
to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Zaza bundle updates are to include an EC pool to validate that
erasure coded pools are properly excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012
'}, {'created': '2021-04-04 03:42:09.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude erasure coded pools from eligible pools

Filter erasure coded pools from the list of eligible pools since
Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not
provide a simple way when querying the pools to see if they are
acting as a metadata pool for an erasure coded RBD pool, the
metadata pools are automatically excluded by naming convention.

For those scenarios where the metadata pool does not follow the
naming convention (<pool>-metadata), a new config option is added
to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Zaza bundle updates are to include an EC pool to validate that
erasure coded pools are properly excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012
'}, {'created': '2021-04-04 03:44:38.000000000', 'message': "Exclude erasure coded pools from eligible pools

Filter erasure coded pools from the list of eligible pools since
Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not
provide a simple way when querying the pools to see if they are
acting as a metadata pool for an erasure coded RBD pool, the
CephBroker requests are updated to accept 'none' as an
rbd_mirroring_mode. When the rbd_mirroring_mode is set to 'none'
this charm will not setup mirroring for hte pool.

For those scenarios where the pool is created by hand, a new config
option is added to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Zaza bundle updates are to include an EC pool to validate that
erasure coded pools are properly excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012
"}, {'created': '2021-04-06 02:15:26.000000000', 'message': "Exclude erasure coded pools from eligible pools

Filter erasure coded pools from the list of eligible pools since
Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not
provide a simple way when querying the pools to see if they are
acting as a metadata pool for an erasure coded RBD pool, the
CephBroker requests are updated to accept 'none' as an
rbd_mirroring_mode. When the rbd_mirroring_mode is set to 'none'
this charm will not setup mirroring for the pool.

For those scenarios where the pool is created by hand, a new config
option is added to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Updates are needed to the mirror_pool_status function as the rbd
commandline client will error out with EINVAL if the mirror pool status
is called for a pool which does not have replication enabled.

Zaza bundle updates are to include an EC pool to validate that
erasure coded pools are properly excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012

Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not

CephBroker requests are updated to accept 'none' as an
rbd_mirroring_mode. When the rbd_mirroring_mode is set to 'none'
this charm will not setup mirroring for the pool.

For those scenarios where the pool is created by hand, a new config
option is added to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Updates are needed to the mirror_pool_status function as the rbd
commandline client will error out with EINVAL if the mirror pool status
is called for a pool which does not have replication enabled.

Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012

commit_message:
Exclude erasure coded pools from eligible pools

Filter erasure coded pools from the list of eligible pools since
Ceph does not support mirroring these pools. Since Ceph does not
provide a simple way when querying the pools to see if they are
acting as a metadata pool for an erasure coded RBD pool, the
CephBroker requests are updated to accept 'none' as an
rbd_mirroring_mode. When the rbd_mirroring_mode is set to 'none'
this charm will not setup mirroring for the pool.

For those scenarios where the pool is created by hand, a new config
option is added to exclude-pools from enabling for replication.

Updates are needed to the mirror_pool_status function as the rbd
commandline client will error out with EINVAL if the mirror pool status
is called for a pool which does not have replication enabled.

Zaza bundle updates are to include an EC pool to validate that
erasure coded pools are properly excluded.

Closes-Bug: #1898504
Change-Id: I083e2dce9b1205b9b0812b3dbc9fe6ea2e29c012

commit_message:
[WIP] Generate wheelhouse at build-time from OpenStack requirements

The charms high level direct dependencies are kept in
src/wheelhouse.txt.in.

A new `generate-wheelhouse-txt` tox target is used to expand the
high level list into a explicit list of dependencies built with
constraints from the upstream OpenStack requirements repository.

The new target is called from the `build` target, so that the
build process for the charm will be no different from other
charms.

Change-Id: Ida8e23630b177da28d3e1a3217f9eab5c0190d80

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I7b7fc379f97853c02f99aafe9abedf68ad942534

subject: Support UTF-8 encoded metadata files
messages:
[{'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-02-21 11:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-02-21 11:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-03-06 08:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30113, 'date': '2020-03-06 08:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-09-16 07:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-09-16 11:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-09-21 05:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

While the patch does not mention it, this seems to be a way to handle the situation when the LANG environment variable is not set correctly (which is the case in pre-2.7 versions of Juju) - older versions of Python do not automatically use the 'utf-8' encoding scheme when reading files open in the non-binary mode.

root@xenial:/tmp# unset LANG
>>> f = open('/tmp/test')
>>> f
<_io.TextIOWrapper name='/tmp/test' mode='r' encoding='ANSI_X3.4-1968'>

>>> content = f.read()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode
    return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0]
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xf0 in position 0: ordinal not in range(128)

The issue has been addressed already in the past for charms using layer-basic (which includes this charm):
https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/pull/174

So I don't think we need this patch with the above layer-basic change.

There are other places where files are being read by the charm such as when reading the sp_signing_keyinfo and sp_private_key content, however, those are ASCII armor-encoded which means they do not go outside the ASCII-compatible UTF-8 range.

I also think that a better approach here would be to avoid having to decode and re-encode altogether. The following should do just fine:

with open(idp_metadata_path, 'rb') as f:
    content = f.read()
    try:
        etree.fromstring(content)'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-09-12 10:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 12 weeks without comment, and failed testing the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Add the specification for disk-replacement

This patchset adds the specs for disk replacement operations in
the ceph-osd charm, including the additions needed for the
'add-disk' action, as well as the new 'remove-disk' action.

Change-Id: I11ba6e21b3b2fd91b6dfd7c64aabcecb1b5be32b

commit_message:
Implemented deferred service restart Nagios check

* New check alerts on CRITICAL when deferred restarts are detected
* New check is found at files/check_rabbitmq_deferred_restarts.py
* New check only runs when `enable-auto-restarts` is False
    * Check is removed when `enable-auto-restarts` returns to True
* Only alerts for deferred service restarts - not deferred hooks
* Implemented similarly to other nagios checks
* New logic required in hooks/rabbitmq_server_relations.py:
    * The `if not allowed` check in `config_changed` function now syncs
    nrpe files and renders the new check

Change-Id: Ie5f339846a5576f502ce743d48571297dd00c7c2

commit_message:
debug: Add loop counter for identity_changed hook.

Add counter and a total count of relations that will run
identity_changed hook. Rationale for this is that running a
identity_changed hook for all relations is a very time consuming task
and the counter and total count allows easy tracking of a progress of
this operation.

Change-Id: Ia21bf77c18464a3d77af486a56694bcb5d8ab89f

subject: Stop to use the __future__ module.
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-02 18:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-07-09 09:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello, do you think is it possible to ask for someone to merge these changes to avoid possible future conflicts and rebases.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-05-20 12:25:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Hi Hervé

The charmhelpers module that we sync into the charms in manages here https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers.  Any changes made directly in the charm will be lost when we next re-sync.

This codebase is still py2 and py3 compatibility as there are a number of charms in the wide ecosystem that still use Python 2.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-12-14 10:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2021-12-14 15:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-12-14 15:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-12-16 16:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2022-09-12 10:51:48.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 12 weeks without comment, and failed testing the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:00:25.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia61dfb629036448f16edf44e3240c362157ffb74

[{'created': '2021-08-16 14:26:41.000000000', 'message': "Match testing matrix to supported backends

The OpenStack Charms project only supports the manila-ganesha
backend for shared filesystems, so testing charm-manila back
to it's introduction in Stein with the manila-generic
backend just to ensure that the manila APIs are working is
both a waste of testing resources as well as asserting a
support level that isn't matched by other systems.
Recent changes in the tests seem to expose an issue in the
manila-generic backend, as deployed by the charms, where
the share isn't being correctly created or something, where
the newer tests fail to actually access the share
concurrently from two guests.

Closes-Bug: #1935022
Change-Id: Id6a0b40cba7bd46f476409a5a7cfdabb50f30839

commit_message:
Match testing matrix to supported backends

The OpenStack Charms project only supports the manila-ganesha
backend for shared filesystems, so testing charm-manila back
to it's introduction in Stein with the manila-generic
backend just to ensure that the manila APIs are working is
both a waste of testing resources as well as asserting a
support level that isn't matched by other systems.

Recent changes in the tests seem to expose an issue in the
manila-generic backend, as deployed by the charms, where
the share isn't being correctly created or something, where
the newer tests fail to actually access the share
concurrently from two guests.

Also synced release-tools in order to fix the build.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/623
Closes-Bug: #1935022
Change-Id: Id6a0b40cba7bd46f476409a5a7cfdabb50f30839
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add Juju storage support

Add support for juju storage. The functional tests should probably
move over to using juju storage too but I'll propose that as a
follow patch to the pr can catch any regression in the existing
functional tests.

Change-Id: I4c70a40e9bc0fe59eeec5165102d43ecad8e86df

commit_message:
ensure that cell properties are updated bedore to start db migration

In order to fix bug/1835037 the database URLs of each cells has to be
well updated that to include any change related to the driver.

Closes-Bug: #1835037
Change-Id: I693793d000cd7176b25f452c7b79b214e23b1b94
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add support for cinder volume encryption r->t

Add support for volume encryption in bionic rocky to bionic train.
After train encryption works without any charm changes. Also add
testing of creating and encrypted volume in bionic rocky onwards.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/662
Change-Id: I13be9899731e777d95351e00d0cc818f4d442251

commit_message:
Enable qemu remote-display-port-min configuration

Add the remote-display-port-min configuration paramter to config.yaml,
defaults to an unset value to preserve compatibilty with previous
charm versions. This setting allows to modify the initial qemu
vnc port 5900 and helps to prevent Intel NUC AMT vnc port overlaps.

Change-Id: I1aa7f7bf35972f884921f77e92ecb913c323d02a
Closes-Bug: #1844786

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Updated test bundles to add second device

In functional testing of the set-weight action, it was found that
changes to ring devices is not triggering rebalance because there
are no changes to the partition placement.  Adding a second device to
the swift-storage units will change the partitions assigned to the disks
and allow for the rebalance and sync of rings to be validated during
functional testing.

Change-Id: I3f72da96edd97a479e0600f35d450fdf8aa077ae
Related-Bug: #1882250
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/328

commit_message:
Mask corosync service

In addition to removing the state left by the corosync
package, mask the service so that upgrades and updates
can process successfully.

This change also pins cffi for python<3.6, syncs pip updates
from release-tools, and updates the test's unit tests to the
new Yoga versions, dropping python3.5 from the upstream unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1942343
Change-Id: Id803ed37729b53a14f20ffcf3cfa4df735c286e7

commit_message:
Implement NFS Support for Charmed Ceph

NFS support will be provided by a new principal charm that will provide
CephFS shares over NFS via the Ganesha package.

Change-Id: I621b697dfa023e97eab8a9c0113f87b439906db5

Explicit instruction to run `configure-resources`

Some config options require running the `configure-resources` action. Be
clear on the point in config.yaml.

Closes-Bug: #1937263

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-01 09:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'Related-Bug: 1922195

Extend charm-ceph-proxy so it can also relate to ceph-fs:ceph-mds. Add ceph-proxy:mds and related code.
Like for the radosgw case, there is a bit of duplication as the standard method to get keyrings used
by ceph-mon relies on
   ceph --name mon.
but no user with that name exists in this case: so we need to issue the get-or-create as admin.

Change-Id: I437dbac9fe018eb2d0ffb87052d61a08aa014473
'}, {'created': '2021-04-02 12:17:43.000000000', 'message': 'Related-Bug: 1922195

Extend charm-ceph-proxy so it can also relate to ceph-fs:ceph-mds. Add ceph-proxy:mds and related code.
Like for the radosgw case, there is a bit of duplication as the standard method to get keyrings used
by ceph-mon relies on
   ceph --name mon.
but no user with that name exists in this case: so we need to issue the get-or-create as admin.
Moreover, added new method as default one assumes user name is like client.whatever

Change-Id: I437dbac9fe018eb2d0ffb87052d61a08aa014473
'}, {'created': '2021-04-08 22:53:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for CephFS.

'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 03:54:37.000000000', 'message': "Add support for CephFS.

Extend ceph-proxy to implement ceph-mds interface, this allows the
ceph-fs to be related.

The functional testing reuses the same zaza tests that the ceph-fs charm
uses, although the 'configure' stage runs `setup_ceph_proxy` as first
step since `basic_overcloud_network` uses juju-wait and will block due
to ceph-fs is in blocked state.

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Reyes <felipe.reyes@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1922195
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/558
Change-Id: I437dbac9fe018eb2d0ffb87052d61a08aa014473

commit_message:
Add support for CephFS.

Extend ceph-proxy to implement ceph-mds interface, this allows the
ceph-fs to be related.

The functional testing reuses the same zaza tests that the ceph-fs charm
uses, although the 'configure' stage runs `setup_ceph_proxy` as first
step since `basic_overcloud_network` uses juju-wait and will block due
to ceph-fs is in blocked state.

Co-Authored-By: Felipe Reyes <felipe.reyes@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: #1922195
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/558
Change-Id: I437dbac9fe018eb2d0ffb87052d61a08aa014473

commit_message:
Add ceph status output to juju status

When the ceph cluster is unhealthy, we can
and should add the message from ceph to the
juju status output

Change-Id: I8a3b458c03e9f81ae883df632d42b6c997cf8b7b
Closes-Bug: #1796430

commit_message:
Stop setting default capabilities in get_named_key.

When get_named_key is called on a keyring that
has customised capabilities, it overwrites the
capabilities to the default capabilities.

Depends-On: I777650ae2194609a95e5cfb101e343824b3d0a34
Change-Id: I2930b32943fb75778cf3b56bb7f1d2a9f9c7c454
(cherry picked from commit 04a9c98dfaa760ff6b469ef448275f7e9796c8e3)

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

This isn't a straight cherry-pick as it eneds to enable the Wallaby
CI jobs as well.

(cherry-picked from commit a7e6225b2b70e9bf09c54b3d1f9b3d2fa53eb4b4)

Change-Id: I57dcc28b826f6434e98b99216cef92ed9126ce85

commit_message:
Option to enable network-segment-range support

To let operators add an additional and optional service plugin into the
deployment configuration as "network_segment_range".
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-network-segment-ranges.html

Closes-Bug: #1965229
Change-Id: Id0ac7c397874ad2c51935e8c0eab64f1ef4f6fd3
(cherry picked from commit c411b90d2d14e7ad7678e0ce0b81ac82fdaffa3a)

commit_message:
insert local modules to sys.path beginning instead of appending to end

local module paths should be inserted into beginning of sys.path, so they can be used first by python interpreter.
Otherwise when a global copy exists, local copy will be ignored, and cause unexpected error.

For example, `charmhelpers` error in this bug:
LP: #1919949

Code in this patch is following existing pattern[0].
paths are inserted at 1 instead 0, because 0 is normally current dir, which should have highest priority.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/charm-nova-compute/blob/433796779e4f31320e6c57527f421d4e9aaacedc/actions/pause_resume.py#L20

Closes-Bug: #1919949
Change-Id: Idd61274b7abd0226b625cf334ab0b7f125146aec
Signed-off-by: Joe Guo <joe.guo@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Implement restore_quorum action using force_quorum_using_partition_of

A network partition coupled causes the cluster to lost quorum. In rare
cases, after the network reestablishment, the cluster cant fix itself
and stays blocked.
This change implements a new action to restore cluster loss of quorum
by using force_quorum_using_partition_of. This has to be used with care
and just in extreme conditions.

Closes-Bug: #1917332
Change-Id: I7fda0bac7486e916514b31af583308c4c14673f6

Add configuration option for entityID.

Sets the entityID in the service provider metadata file.
If not provided, entityID is autogenerated.

commit_message:
Minor cleanup

Update the prefix for charms from cs: to ch: in the readme and
add a .zuul and .gitreview file. Fix the tests to point to the
right charms from charmhub. Add focal-yoga and jammy-yoga test
buckets.

Change-Id: I7ffd252b62022707504016498df5d157f7d8d953

commit_message:
Update python testing as per zed cycle testing runtime

In Zed cycle, we have dropped the python 3.6/3.7[1] testing
and its support. Moving the py36 job to py38 based as well as
updating the python classifier also to reflect the same.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I66f32ce3ae4a0aa032fc8918d83bef30a588d18b

commit_message:
Re-render configuration files when new certificates are presented.

When certificates presented by ovn-chassis over the ovsdb-subordinate
relation change the configuration files need to be rendered again to
reflect the possible change of certificates, the most common scenario
where this is needed is when the certificates are rotate with the
"reissue-certificates" action from Vault charm.

Closes-Bug: #1952279
Change-Id: If7d4783bb8ee8583ec5ce8b9f13da9bcf4c5952f

[{'created': '2021-10-05 23:41:40.000000000', 'message': "Remove departed mon from map

When a unit departs, we need to actually remove the mon so that
further commands aren't directed at it. Thus, it is necessary to
tell ceph that a particular mon should be removed.

commit_message:
Remove departed mon from map

When a unit departs, we need to actually remove the mon so that
further commands aren't directed at it. Thus, it is necessary to
tell ceph that a particular mon should be removed.

Change-Id: I78953cea629c1a31ce842c85fb9f601f85043cc1
Closes-Bug: #1833252
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/650

subject: Add action mark-seeded
messages:
[{'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-16 19:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-16 21:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-17 18:36:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I added log("Marking seeded.", level=DEBUG) to know if/when mark_seeded() is being called. This test run failed with the following line:
2020-03-16 21:43:31 [INFO] Checking percona-cluster/2
2020-03-16 21:43:31 [WARNING] Stderr: cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
2020-03-16 21:43:31 [INFO] code: 1 , output: 
2020-03-16 21:43:31 [INFO] FAIL

Checking /var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-2.log the following line is found 
2020-03-16 21:48:33 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.

I think we need a "seeded.flush()" after "seeded.write('done')"?'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-17 20:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Running the tests locally I got the same failure, so inspecting it closer this is what I found:

The seeded file is created at 19:43:
2020-03-17 19:43:53 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.

# stat /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded
...
Modify: 2020-03-17 19:43:53.707186871 +0000
Change: 2020-03-17 19:43:53.707186871 +0000

On the side of where I was running the tests I got this:

2020-03-17 19:38:39 [INFO] Ensyring PXC seeded file is present
2020-03-17 19:38:42 [INFO] Checking percona-cluster/2
2020-03-17 19:38:45 [WARNING] Stderr: cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
2020-03-17 19:38:45 [INFO] code: 1 , output: 
2020-03-17 19:38:45 [INFO] FAIL

So the test is running *before* the hooks have settled and the bootstrapping process has completed.

So the test would require some minor changes to wait until the seeded file appears or timeout after X minutes'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-17 20:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I did this change to the test https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/bn8hD88WkP/ will re-run the ci job'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-17 20:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-18 01:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-19 17:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

2020-03-18 02:30:02 [INFO] Ensuring PXC seeded file is present
2020-03-18 03:15:03 [INFO] ERROR

^ after 45 minutes the test fails, because the seeded file didn't appear according to zaza, but checking the units' logs:

$ grep "Marking seeded" percona-cluster_*/var/log/juju/unit-percona*log
percona-cluster_0/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-0.log:2020-03-18 02:10:35 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_0/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-0.log:2020-03-18 02:12:26 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_0/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-0.log:2020-03-18 02:17:46 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_0/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-0.log:2020-03-18 03:19:05 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_0/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-0.log:2020-03-18 03:22:05 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.

percona-cluster_1/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-1.log:2020-03-18 02:16:02 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_1/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-1.log:2020-03-18 02:18:07 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_1/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-1.log:2020-03-18 03:17:41 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_1/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-1.log:2020-03-18 03:20:37 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.

percona-cluster_2/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-2.log:2020-03-18 02:16:35 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_2/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-2.log:2020-03-18 02:21:58 DEBUG juju-log cluster:2: Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_2/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-2.log:2020-03-18 03:18:42 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.
percona-cluster_2/var/log/juju/unit-percona-cluster-2.log:2020-03-18 03:21:35 DEBUG juju-log Marking seeded.


so 3 units seems to have been marked as seeded very early and there would be no reason for this test to time out.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-19 17:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-19 19:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, so this is before test_100_cold_start_bootstrap kicks in the seeded file is OK:

juju run -m zaza-5d27087af241 --application percona-cluster 'sudo cat /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded'
- Stdout: done
  UnitId: percona-cluster/0
- Stdout: done
  UnitId: percona-cluster/1
- Stdout: done
  UnitId: percona-cluster/2

But during the execution of that test:

juju run -m zaza-5d27087af241 --application percona-cluster 'sudo cat /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded'
- Stdout: done
  UnitId: percona-cluster/1
- ReturnCode: 1
  Stderr: |
    cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
  Stdout: ""
  UnitId: percona-cluster/0
- ReturnCode: 1
  Stderr: |
    cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
  Stdout: ""
  UnitId: percona-cluster/2

Then by the end of that test when it's waiting for the units to get ready:

2020-03-19 16:03:17 [INFO] Execute notify-bootstrapped action after cold boot on the leader node ...
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Waiting for a unit to appear
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Waiting for all units to be idle
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status of hacluster/1
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status message of hacluster/1
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status of hacluster/2
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status message of hacluster/2
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status of hacluster/0
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status message of hacluster/0
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status of keystone/0
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status message of keystone/0
2020-03-19 16:04:10 [INFO] Checking workload status of percona-cluster/2

The seeded file is not present for all the units:

juju run -m zaza-5d27087af241 --application percona-cluster 'sudo cat /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded'
- ReturnCode: 1
  Stderr: |
    cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
  Stdout: ""
  UnitId: percona-cluster/0
- Stdout: done
  UnitId: percona-cluster/1
- ReturnCode: 1
  Stderr: |
    cat: /var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded: No such file or directory
  Stdout: ""
  UnitId: percona-cluster/2

So this is the test that breaks things.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-19 21:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

auditd is showing the removal of the seeded file, this is happening when bootstrap-pxc is executed in another unit.

type=SYSCALL msg=audit(1584651122.410:39): arch=c000003e syscall=263 success=yes exit=0 a0=ffffff9c a1=561da7ad1190 a2=0 a3=100 items=2 ppid=3046 pid=3048 auid=4294967295 uid=112 gid=117 euid=112 suid=112 fsuid=112 egid=117 sgid=117 fsgid=117 tty=(none) ses=4294967295 comm="rm" exe="/bin/rm" key=(null)

type=PATH msg=audit(1584651122.410:39): item=1 name="/var/lib/percona-xtradb-cluster/seeded" inode=268504 dev=fc:01 mode=0100644 ouid=0 ogid=0 rdev=00:00 nametype=DELETE cap_fp=0000000000000000 cap_fi=0000000000000000 cap_fe=0 cap_fver=0'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2020-03-19 21:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

when running the action notify-bootstrapped in the leader unit will trigger leader-settings-changed hook which would be the moment to re-create the seeded file, but since this check[0] is False[1] will never get to mark_seeded()[2]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 19:06:29.000000000', 'message': "Add action mark-seeded

The charm uses a file named 'seeded' to determine if the cluster is ready
to perform operations by the charm hooks (e.g. create a database on
shared-db-relation-changed), there could be a case where an operator needs
to manipulate the cluster outside the charm's context and this action would
allow them to mark the unit as ready to process requests after that said
manipulation.

Change-Id: I13d2ff75c656a952629f6ba40a5c2d24247a7682
Closes-Bug: #1867456

commit_message:
Add action mark-seeded

The charm uses a file named 'seeded' to determine if the cluster is ready
to perform operations by the charm hooks (e.g. create a database on
shared-db-relation-changed), there could be a case where an operator needs
to manipulate the cluster outside the charm's context and this action would
allow them to mark the unit as ready to process requests after that said
manipulation.

Change-Id: I13d2ff75c656a952629f6ba40a5c2d24247a7682
Closes-Bug: #1867456
Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/204

commit_message:
Fix updating a non-HTTP(S) Health Monitor

Prevent octavia-dashboard from sending parameters that trigger a
InvalidOption exception when updating a non-HTTP/non-HTTPS health
monitor.

Story 2008803
Task 42223

Change-Id: Ie669829b149001f77f7475216b86a33d96cb5ff5

commit_message:
DNM wheelhouse: add Cython as dependency

For some reason charm-tools does not pick up on this dependency
yet install fails when it's not there.

__NOTE__ remove bundle changes before merge

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/786
Change-Id: Ic4ed229c4fd7e795ad2a978690a4028015a085c6

appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,

the Xena guide for legacy type charm coverage.

This PR will be backported to the Yoga guide.

[{'created': '2022-04-14 11:50:05.000000000', 'message': 'Bypass charm going into blocked due to a bug

After Octopus, the reporting about image states fails
because of a permission issue in Ceph. This change
disables that status reporting to allow a deployment
to be healthy even when some tools cannot query status.

Related-Bug: #1879749
Change-Id: I5bba54230febf09475dffef9c810a89dd542ac1a

commit_message:
Bypass charm going into blocked due to a bug

After Octopus, the reporting about image states fails
because of a permission issue in Ceph. This change
disables that status reporting to allow a deployment
to be healthy even when some tools cannot query status.

Related-Bug: #1879749
Change-Id: I5bba54230febf09475dffef9c810a89dd542ac1a

subject: Drop use of port 35357
messages:
[{'account_id': 16523, 'date': '2018-09-03 09:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24297, 'date': '2018-09-12 20:00:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Lei, correct me if I'm wrong, but I believe the change to charmhelpers (utils.py) needs to be made upstream first (charmhelpers) and then synced into this charm afterwards.

Then, use `make sync` in the keystone charm to re-sync the charm with charm-helpers in your gerrit review.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-05-29 09:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-05-29 10:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2020-05-29 10:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-12-14 10:49:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

Forcing a full snapshot with clone option may cause addInstance
to fail because there is an already stablished group replication.

Change-Id: I8426cd49c8201b3f116d8cacb353453cc6fba588
'}, {'created': '2021-01-21 20:40:38.000000000', 'message': 'Set recoveryMethod from clone to auto

Forcing a full snapshot with clone option may cause addInstance
to fail because there is an already stablished group replication.

'}]
commit_message:
Set recoveryMethod from clone to auto

Forcing a full snapshot with clone option may cause addInstance
to fail because there is an already stablished group replication.

Interactive mode should be disabled since charm is handling
this call.

Closes-Bug: #1912688
Change-Id: I8426cd49c8201b3f116d8cacb353453cc6fba588

commit_message:
zuul: fix the grenade job to actually test barbican

Add the required services and run a few barbican-specific tests
to validate the upgrade.

The grenade plugin contains a few settings which don't need to be
set anymore explicitly and they are not in the job configuration
(as devstack/upgrade/settings is not used anymore):
- all the image-related variables don't need to be overridden anymore,
  the default one from devstack should be used
- Image API v1 has been disabled since tempest 20.0

The job can be switched to voting again.

Change-Id: Id0682aea57d4d1fc49334f2dd11ef9a0ffb355fb

commit_message:
Fix Non-OpenStack dynamic pollster credentials handling

There was a problem with the barbican credentials processing for
Non-OpenStack dynamic pollster. The credentials variables would be
retrieved as a byte string, which would break the processing.
Therefore, we needed to introduce a method to check if the credentials
are a String object. if they are not, we convert them to String.

Change-Id: I2084061eb8f543d4c557963599732e35cfa22996

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-03-30 09:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-30 13:18:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the contribution! I didn't actually review yet, but see my inline comment to get the CI green."}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-03-31 00:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-31 09:35:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Thanks a lot for the contribution! It looks good in general. If I understand correctly, shared-db and storage-backend-etcd are mutually exclusive and things will go wrong if both are used, correct? If yes I'd like to see the unit going into 'blocked' or 'error' state if both are used, with a clear status message for the operator.

Also I'd like to have this feature described in the charm's readme and release-noted. Thanks a lot!"}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-03-31 09:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-03-31 13:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1
> 
> Thanks a lot for the contribution! It looks good in general. If I understand correctly, shared-db and storage-backend-etcd are mutually exclusive and things will go wrong if both are used, correct? If yes I'd like to see the unit going into 'blocked' or 'error' state if both are used, with a clear status message for the operator.
> 
> Also I'd like to have this feature described in the charm's readme and release-noted. Thanks a lot!


Yes, in that case, Vault wouldn't start or would go into an error state. I'm agreed with you that the new functionality should be documented properly, but not sure we should assume all of the cases including that an operator would add all of the available relations unconditionally. In any case, I will take a look if we can have a better logic."}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-04-01 01:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-04-01 06:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Support use of etcd as a storage backend for Vault

This change adds an option for the charm user to specify etcd as the
storage backend for Vault. This is in addition to the option of using
it as the HA storage which already exists prior to this change.

The existing functional test as "test_consistent_read_write" will check
that a written data can be read from all vault units in HA scenarios as
the same way as other storage backends already availalbe such as MySQL
and PostgreSQL.

Co-Authored-By: Mark S. Maglana <mark.maglana@canonical.com>
Closes-Bug: 1883242
Change-Id: I2ec6285a44bb5e1914839bd33dc1e778ae4a85fd

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I0776bad299d133b61dc8e2941c40eeb572f5af78

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I2c98ab0f82aa6d6d0a43365cee04d6da34a39ce4

commit_message:
Use venv instead of virtualenv

virtualenv is not a part of the core python installation, but
venv is. Let's use it to be slimmer and avoid issues with
virtualenv installation.

At the same time, remove some existing hacks around selinux,
systemd, PyYAML and libvirt.

Change-Id: Icd60aca084323cede944ee261d2cf5941b320e4b

commit_message:
Fix misuse of assert statements

Replace 'called_once_with' with 'assert_called_once_with'.
Replace 'called_once' with 'assert_called_once_with'.

Change-Id: I1d3c444c3e01b862a1a2571cf13d054dfd2fb463
Closes-Bug: 1989267
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I506c53b4956024066bc769665525cb022438a0ae

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I3cc0af8443ecf62589c88d4e924cb633c419e87f

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml
* enable qos service plugin for neutron-api to ensure
  migrate-ovn-db action is successful

Change-Id: I6f94ff3e557413b6096493f839c0a5f217c017d3
Closes-Bug: #1988089

subject: Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-10 14:51:00.000000000', 'message': 'wip: allow charm to work on Jammy

The cryptography pin does not work well with jammy as the compiled
artifact is not compatible with OpenSSL 3.0.

Given we already compile C dependencies on the hosts, the reasoing
of not using the most recent version of cryptography because it
depends on a rust compiler is a bit weird.

Also, it may be that we need a different version of the charm for
Focal and Jammy, which does not sitt well with the current build
strategy of renaming *.charm to charm-name.charm, effectively
overwriting the multiple artifacts that charmcraft provides when
specifying multiple bases in charmcraft.yaml.

Experiment a bit with how to resolve these issues, relevant bugs:
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zosci-config/issues/222
https://github.com/openstack-charmers/release-tools/issues/249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-octavia-diskimage-retrofit/+bug/1981334

Change-Id: I8c924038ee1c5ff258c41a44ad14ebc86a107b1b
'}, {'created': '2022-09-06 16:38:44.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Build separately for each supported series

__NOTE__: This review contains in-flight layer code and makes
use of wip changes to charm-tools.  These need to merge and
release before we can merge this patch set.

Charms for OpenStack Yoga supports both Ubuntu Focal and Jammy
which means Python 3.8 and Python 3.10.  Managing dependencies
across those two versions is non-trivial and we need to build
the charm on the series the charm is supposed to support.

The cryptography pin does not work well with jammy as the compiled
artifact is not compatible with OpenSSL 3.0.

Given we already compile C dependencies on the hosts, the
reasoning of not using the most recent version of cryptography
because it depends on a rust compiler is a bit weird.

Update charm to consume the 1.0/stable track for the snap.

Bundles:
- Drop the renaming of the charm artifact and reference the
  series specific charm artifact in the bundles instead.
- Fix gss mirror list, jammy retrofit-series and use 8.0/stable
  for MySQL.

Closes-Bug: #1981334
Change-Id: I8c924038ee1c5ff258c41a44ad14ebc86a107b1b
'}, {'created': '2022-09-08 11:57:24.000000000', 'message': "Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds

Charms for OpenStack Yoga supports both Ubuntu Focal and Jammy
which means Python 3.8 and Python 3.10.  Managing dependencies
across those two versions is non-trivial and we need to build
the charm on the series the charm is supposed to support.

Switch to using a binary build which allows pip's dependency
resolution to work.

Update charm to consume the 1.0/stable track for the snap.

Bundles:
- Drop the renaming of the charm artifact and reference the
  series specific charm artifact in the bundles instead.
- Fix gss mirror list, jammy retrofit-series and use 8.0/stable
  for MySQL.

Closes-Bug: #1981334
Closes-Bug: #1970653
Closes-Bug: #1975491
Change-Id: I8c924038ee1c5ff258c41a44ad14ebc86a107b1b
"}]
commit_message:
Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds

Charms for OpenStack Yoga supports both Ubuntu Focal and Jammy
which means Python 3.8 and Python 3.10.  Managing dependencies
across those two versions is non-trivial and we need to build
the charm on the series the charm is supposed to support.

Switch to using a binary build which allows pip's dependency
resolution to work.

Update charm to consume the 1.0/stable track for the snap.

Bundles:
- Drop the renaming of the charm artifact and reference the
  series specific charm artifact in the bundles instead.
- Fix gss mirror list, jammy retrofit-series and use 8.0/stable
  for MySQL.

Closes-Bug: #1981334
Closes-Bug: #1970653
Closes-Bug: #1975491
Change-Id: I8c924038ee1c5ff258c41a44ad14ebc86a107b1b

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-12 08:26:07.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I19ca35f799f55290075549aaaa60d6338c5430b7
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I19ca35f799f55290075549aaaa60d6338c5430b7

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: Id51983eefbde856a2c1d950b590dea6543db1c55

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I782ea5c502b7bc0eb9941c7eb8d4b830f07b218a

commit_message:
Add etcd3gw api_version to cinder backend_url 

tooz etcd3gw driver makes use of api_version in backend_url from cinder.conf

api_version specifies the endpoint used for communication between etcd3gw and
Etcd service.

This patch ensures that the correct api_version is passed to tooz to
implement Etcd <-> etcd3gw compatibility as shown below.

  EtcdV3.4 (el9) supports /v3/
  EtcdV3.2 (el8) supports /v3aplha/

Depends-On: Ib30c1e003f261cd7e1ac6fed87167f9974bf8542
Closes-Bug: 1983668
Change-Id: I8f00c1b4299743e2ad21b25b6a1aeddca6edfd34

projects: skyline-apiserver and skyline-console.

projects.

commit_message:
Add stable branch tests for centos-8s tempest tests

Add a variation of the telemetry-dsvm-integration-centos-8s jobs using
branch selectors and provide a config for python 3.6 on older branches
(i.e. pre-yoga)

Change-Id: Ia57b83c7d764e2bb4eda19a46034ff2d3353aff7

commit_message:
Make tests pass after 2038

time.time is used to not just shift the exiry time further into the future.

This bug was found while working on reproducible builds for openSUSE.

Change-Id: I146be9afa3ef54288218daa7ae21f7a7cb5aab67

commit_message:
WIP: Stop using mdev_name2uuid and fix mdev recreation

Be smarter, use the existing possibilities.

TODO: a shit ton of things, sorry about it.
 - UTs
 - Broken functests for reshape
 - possible wrong things I stupidly wrote.

Change-Id: Ifbe64cbed9b1a98bf7469d9de6bcb3e9cee10540
Closes-Bug: #1900800

'}, {'created': '2022-08-25 07:29:04.000000000', 'message': "[sqlalchemy-20] Drop retry decorator from disassociate_floatingips

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin.disassociate_floatingips is called
indirectly from Ml2Plugin.delete_port which has a
retry decorator and an active DB writer transaction, so
removing the extra ones.

It's also called from OVNL3RouterPlugin.disassociate_floatingips
which don't have retry decorator and active DB writer transaction.
For this added disassociate_floatingips_retry utility method with
retry decorator and DB writer trnasaction.

Related-Bug: #1964575
Change-Id: I0dd81cdc31de403a893a89ecbce4a92740bf9508
"}]
commit_message:
[sqlalchemy-20] Drop retry decorator from disassociate_floatingips

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin.disassociate_floatingips is called
indirectly from Ml2Plugin.delete_port which has a
retry decorator and an active DB writer transaction, so
removing the extra ones.

It's also called from OVNL3RouterPlugin.disassociate_floatingips
which don't have retry decorator and active DB writer transaction.
For this added disassociate_floatingips_retry utility method with
retry decorator and DB writer trnasaction.

Related-Bug: #1964575
Change-Id: I0dd81cdc31de403a893a89ecbce4a92740bf9508

commit_message:
Enable retries when sending notifications

This patch enables retries when a connection error occurred
at the time of sending a notification.

This patch introduces a new config parameter
v2_vnfm.notify_connect_retries that specifies the maximum number
of retries. Note that the period between retries is exponential
starting 0.5 seconds up to a maximum of 60 seconds.

Change-Id: Ie75a7d1ec7a8dd8970b1cf58cff86f699bcc3311

commit_message:
Add OpenID Connect Token Auth for k8s

This patch adds openid token auth support when calling k8s APIs.

Openid token auth of k8s relies on an external openid provider,
and Keycloak acts as the openid provider in this implementation.

Implements: blueprint support-openid-k8s-vim
Change-Id: Ie5e080a20cba3ba0ed514ede7955eb16729d797c

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ic3964022731ee609e25e4d267eee1ea2238aa428

commit_message:
Validate CollectdConnectionType

The CollectdConnectionType parameter accepts only specific values
(amqp1 and network). This change makes the given value validated
during stack creation so that a wrong value can be detected early.

Change-Id: If700a6d9808e7465c870d675122acfef049a3dc7

subject: ironic: Remove tasks for image migration
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-06-16 02:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2022-07-04 13:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2022-09-12 01:33:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-16 02:47:59.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: Remove tasks for image migration

This removes the tasks to copy image data from /(http|tftp)root to
/var/lib/ironic/(http|tftp)root. These tasks were implemented to
migrate image data from the old paths we used before containerizing
undercloud and now all image files should be created in the new paths
by the overcloud image command.

Change-Id: If47d88e526ead2a9fdf1610f19303898d6847472
'}]
commit_message:
ironic: Remove tasks for image migration

This removes the tasks to copy image data from /(http|tftp)root to
/var/lib/ironic/(http|tftp)root. These tasks were implemented to
migrate image data from the old paths we used before containerizing
undercloud and now all image files should be created in the new paths
by the overcloud image command.

Change-Id: If47d88e526ead2a9fdf1610f19303898d6847472

commit_message:
Ironic: Remove unused step_config from base class

The step_config property of the ironic base class is not used. The base
puppet class is now included by the individual service classes.

Change-Id: Ied8561595fe340b77dd2d0c294930f98c728ae7c

[{'created': '2022-09-12 01:43:21.000000000', 'message': 'Get OVS DB query results

Change-Id: I1ce8696a181721eea32f4119917891bc98b811f3

commit_message:
Get OVS DB query results

This change adds output of a few ovs-vsctl commands, so that we can
review objects in OVS DB such as bridge and port, and configurations in
the other_config column.

Change-Id: I1ce8696a181721eea32f4119917891bc98b811f3

commit_message:
Cleanup submitted SNMP driver code for additional PDUs

* Resolved PEP8 issues
* Trimmed comments to remove extraneous information
* Changed rfc1902.Integer() calls to the correct snmp.Integer() calls
* Fixed power state logic checking for new PDUs that don't have transitional states (e.g., 'pendingOn')
* Removed redundant warning messages
* Added unit tests for Raritan PD2, ServerTech Sentry 3/4, and Vertiv Geist drivers
* Updated documentation to list tested PDUs for the new drivers
* Updated release notes

Change-Id: I9da7b9042b817c346f75a44cd8287e1f63efcb56

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-11-01 05:10:40.000000000', 'message': "Tracing: Remove all but the OpenTracing code

Now that we have opentracing intergrated a bunch of the original tracing
code, like saving to json, isn't really required anymore. So this patch
removes most the extra code.

The trace_data object remains as we use the start_time for delta
calculations, enter and leave seem interesting to have logged in tacing
so we get some harder numbers. And the callstack in the trace_data needs
to be there for trace name uniqueness for when we use more then one of
the same middleware. (at least for now).

Also fixed some time delta assumptions that was wrong.

Change-Id: Ibb2cfa6e324de0801468860ab9a71edb94ef5c99
"}, {'created': '2021-11-08 04:30:35.000000000', 'message': "Tracing: Remove all but the OpenTracing code

Now that we have opentracing intergrated a bunch of the original tracing
code, like saving to json, isn't really required anymore. So this patch
removes most the extra code.

The trace_data object remains as we use the start_time for delta
calculations, enter and leave seem interesting to have logged in tacing
so we get some harder numbers. And the callstack in the trace_data needs
to be there for trace name uniqueness for when we use more then one of
the same middleware. (at least for now).

Also fixed some time delta assumptions that was wrong.

This patch also does better current span tracking when we use
conextmanagers. A tracer looses it's active span when doing through an
eventlet pile. So better tracking means we can pull what should be the
latest from inside the green thread, making them trace properly

Change-Id: Ibb2cfa6e324de0801468860ab9a71edb94ef5c99

"}, {'created': '2022-01-31 02:57:49.000000000', 'message': "trace: Add RequestTraceMiddleware

This middleware is used to enable request tracing. At this stage the is
no actual HMAC To start tracing so any value can be put into the
query_string parameter trace_sig. When you do that req will be traced.

The middleware also introduces another option which will trace every x
request. This can be handy if you want to insert the middleware into
something like the internal client config.

The request will start and stop tracing as the request hits this
middleware. As such, to get as much info as possible it's best to have it
as close to the front of the pipeline as possible.

The proxy has been instrumented so when making calls to storage nodes,
so long as the middleware is also inserted into the storage node
pipelines, the tracing context is injected into the sub requests allowing
us to trace a single request throughout the cluster.

Request tracing utilises the OpenTracing framework. So if you want to
trace there is a run time dependency on python opentracing module.

There is a trace_data object which contains the start_time for delta
calculations, enter and leave seem interesting to have logged in case we
want access in the code (though I might still remove this as we get
timings as part of opentracing). The data structure also has a callstack
which is being used for name uniqueness. This data structure was used
pre OpenTracing was implemented. And might be removed before the final
version, but some code currently still requires it, so haven't removed
it... yet.

Change-Id: Ibb2cfa6e324de0801468860ab9a71edb94ef5c99
"}, {'created': '2022-03-09 22:37:58.000000000', 'message': "trace: Add RequestTraceMiddleware

commit_message:
trace: Add RequestTraceMiddleware

This middleware is used to enable request tracing. At this stage the is
no actual HMAC To start tracing so any value can be put into the
query_string parameter trace_sig. When you do that req will be traced.

The middleware also introduces another option which will trace every x
request. This can be handy if you want to insert the middleware into
something like the internal client config.

The request will start and stop tracing as the request hits this
middleware. As such, to get as much info as possible it's best to have it
as close to the front of the pipeline as possible.

The proxy has been instrumented so when making calls to storage nodes,
so long as the middleware is also inserted into the storage node
pipelines, the tracing context is injected into the sub requests allowing
us to trace a single request throughout the cluster.

Request tracing utilises the OpenTracing framework. So if you want to
trace there is a run time dependency on python opentracing module.

There is a trace_data object which contains the start_time for delta
calculations, enter and leave seem interesting to have logged in case we
want access in the code (though I might still remove this as we get
timings as part of opentracing). The data structure also has a callstack
which is being used for name uniqueness. This data structure was used
pre OpenTracing was implemented. And might be removed before the final
version, but some code currently still requires it, so haven't removed
it... yet.

Change-Id: Ibb2cfa6e324de0801468860ab9a71edb94ef5c99

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-08-24 08:54:38.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add support cnf auto heal and scale

Support container based VNF AutoHeal and AutoScale operation with
External Monitoring Tools.

Add the Fault Management interfaces and CLI to support AutoHeal.
Add the Performance Management interfaces and CLI to support
AutoScale. The Fault Management and Performance Management
interfaces are based on ETSI NFV-SOL 002 v3.3.1 and ETSI NFV-SOL
003 v3.3.1, which are Version "2.0.0" API of Tacker. Add the
Prometheus Plugin that has a interface between tacker and the
External Monitoring Tool.

Implements: blueprint support-auto-lcm
Change-Id: I7023a72b73f17f3746c74d311919497c7c4e8b3f

commit_message:
Add support cnf auto heal and scale

Support container based VNF AutoHeal and AutoScale operation with
External Monitoring Tools.

Add the Fault Management interfaces and CLI to support AutoHeal.
Add the Performance Management interfaces and CLI to support
AutoScale. The Fault Management and Performance Management
interfaces are based on ETSI NFV-SOL 002 v3.3.1 and ETSI NFV-SOL
003 v3.3.1, which are Version "2.0.0" API of Tacker. Add the
Prometheus Plugin that has a interface between tacker and the
External Monitoring Tool.

Implements: blueprint support-auto-lcm
Change-Id: I7023a72b73f17f3746c74d311919497c7c4e8b3f

subject: Revert "Disable pxe_tftp systemd services during upgrade"
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-12 01:19:17.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Disable pxe_tftp systemd services during upgrade"

This reverts commit 89ecaeb1152b22f41b74c9e594acfb4dddb056eb.

Reason for revert:
The ironic_pxe_tftp service has never been deployed. The correct
service name is tripleo_ironic_pxe_tftp.service. Because the original
change does not explain why the service should be stopped, this change
reverts the useless change instead of fixing it.

Conflicts:
	deployment/ironic/ironic-pxe-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I798a32accc74265fbb3755fb2fb8f25799adc120
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Disable pxe_tftp systemd services during upgrade"

This reverts commit 89ecaeb1152b22f41b74c9e594acfb4dddb056eb.

Reason for revert:
The ironic_pxe_tftp service has never been deployed. The correct
service name is tripleo_ironic_pxe_tftp.service. Because the original
change does not explain why the service should be stopped, this change
reverts the useless change instead of fixing it.

Conflicts:
	deployment/ironic/ironic-pxe-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I798a32accc74265fbb3755fb2fb8f25799adc120

commit_message:
Add docs describing classless PTR delegation

We have had a few questions about classless IN-ADDR.ARPA delegation (RFC 2317) recently. This patch adds a section to the PTR user guide that describes how to setup classless PTR delegation using Designate.

Change-Id: I8e51ccdc0a4bc0d670ba6c7522a83980de7dac9d

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: I1140e9437dcd30ee025bba125748ff984c46cb5f

commit_message:
Define 2023.1 cycle testing runtime

It updates the ubuntu version to 22.04 and python
version to py3.10 which is default in Ubuntu 22.04.
Python 3.9 and python3.10 will be the two versions
to test in 2023.1 cycle.

Moving Centos stream in the list of 'Best effort' to test
them.

Change-Id: I008d086279f0105561a74216a67a3aa9e624fec7

commit_message:
remove unicode prefix from code

All strings are considered as unicode string from Python 3.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
appearances from the unicode strings.

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: Ifb9dc54424256d5cffe557894b2d26b2401ebf92
(cherry picked from commit d60ccd46b9d11a3127f20dd6da69d2faedb50269)

[{'created': '2022-09-08 11:46:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix host:port handling

When we check the EC2 signature without the port part of the host value
received, we should properly split host:port. Keep in mind the splitting
should work for values like [fc00::]:123 too.

Change-Id: I1d90dfcea3568e2a9b22069daa428ea6a2a38bd6
Closes-Bug: #1988168
(cherry picked from commit 6c35b366e3c8c6d7f47471b93f5315582301c5ef)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix host:port handling

When we check the EC2 signature without the port part of the host value
received, we should properly split host:port. Keep in mind the splitting
should work for values like [fc00::]:123 too.

Change-Id: I1d90dfcea3568e2a9b22069daa428ea6a2a38bd6
Closes-Bug: #1988168
(cherry picked from commit 6c35b366e3c8c6d7f47471b93f5315582301c5ef)

commit_message:
Improve Unit Test for V2 API

In the existing v2 unit test, there are many public methods that
are not tested. This led to bugs in some code and also increased
rework in FT.

This patch adds tests to some public methods and improves some
existing tests. Also fixed several minor issues checked out in UT.

Change-Id: I15b45d99646babbb57606dbb46aa156aa9dfb51c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-12 17:23:26.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d

commit_message:
[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-07-15 13:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully ERROR in _init_instance vnic_type changed

If the vnic_type of a bound port changes from "direct" to "macvtap" and
then the compute service is restarted then during _init_instance nova
tries to plug the vif of the changed port. However as it now has macvtap
vnic_type nova tries to look up the netdev of the parent VF. Still that
VF is consumed by the instance so there is no such netdev on the host
OS. This error killed the compute service at startup due to unhandled
exception. This patch adds the exception handler, logs an ERROR and
continue initializing other instances on the host.

Also this patch adds a detailed ERROR log when nova detects that the
vnic_type changed during _heal_instance_info_cache periodic.

TODO:
* unti test
* reno

Closes-Bug: #1981813
Change-Id: I1719f8eda04e8d15a3b01f0612977164c4e55e85
'}, {'created': '2022-07-18 11:56:56.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully ERROR in _init_instance if vnic_type changed
